title: Kenya court finds interior minister and police chief guilty of contempt
text:
March 28, 2018 / 4:21 PM / in 2 minutes Kenya court finds interior minister and police chief guilty of contempt Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
NAIROBI (Reuters) - A Kenyan high court judge found Interior Minister Fred Matiangâ€™i and the inspector general of police guilty of contempt of court on Wednesday and ordered that they appear for sentencing. Kenya's interior minister Fred Matiang'i speaks during a press conference in Nairobi, Kenya. January 31, 2018. REUTERS/Baz Ratner 
The ruling marks a significant escalation in a tussle between the judiciary and the government of President Uhuru Kenyatta, which opposition leaders and other critics say fails to respect the authority of the courts in political matters. Reporting by Humphrey Malalo; Writing by Elias Biryabarema; Editing by Maggie Fick and Matthew Mpoke Bigg
